DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Agent Transfer Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Dose Day Number Sentinel CDM Dispensing Prescription Supply Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another._Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager._Executed and carried through to completion._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification._Days Supply. Number of days that the medication supports based on the number of doses as reported by the pharmacist. This amount is typically found on the dispensings record. It should not be necessary to calculate this variable for use in the SCDM. Positive integer values are expected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Agent Transfer Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Dose Day Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another._Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager._Executed and carried through to completion._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Protocol Agent Transfer Administration Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created manually for CDM CDE curation project 8.24.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sentinel CDM Dispensing Prescription Supply Day Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Days Supply. Number of days that the medication supports based on the number of doses as reported by the pharmacist. This amount is typically found on the dispensings record. It should not be necessary to calculate this variable for use in the SCDM. Positive integer values are expected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.origin: Sentinel CDM:The Sentinel Common Data Model

DataElement.origin: Sentinel CDM:The Sentinel Common Data Model
DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.1 and Sentinel value set for CDM.
